info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 1:15PM CDT until May 10 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Tuscaloosa.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 115 PM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Brookwood, Coaling, Coker, Bryant Denny Stadium, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, University Mall, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, McFarland Mall, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Shelton State Community College, Lake Lurleen State Park, Binion Creek Landing, Lake Wildwood, University Of Alabama Quad, Lake Tuscaloosa Dam, Oliver Lock And Dam and Sexton Bend.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
